db:abstract.db:para: The QAccessibleTextRemoveEvent class notifies of text being deleted.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: This class is used with QAccessible::updateAccessibility().

db:section.db:title: QAccessibleTextRemoveEvent::QAccessibleTextRemoveEvent(QAccessibleInterface *iface, int position, const QString &text)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new QAccessibleTextRemoveEvent event for iface. The text has been removed at position. By default it is assumed that the cursor has moved to position. If that is not the case, one needs to manually set it with QAccessibleTextCursorEvent::setCursorPosition() for this event.

db:section.db:title: QAccessibleTextRemoveEvent::QAccessibleTextRemoveEvent(QObject *object, int position, const QString &text)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new QAccessibleTextRemoveEvent event for object. The text has been removed at position. By default it is assumed that the cursor has moved to position. If that is not the case, one needs to manually set it with QAccessibleTextCursorEvent::setCursorPosition() for this event.

db:section.db:title: int QAccessibleTextRemoveEvent::changePosition() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the position where the text was removed.

db:section.db:title: QString QAccessibleTextRemoveEvent::textRemoved() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the text that has been removed.
